title: Aussie
body:
I just returned to my homeland for the summer (well, in the US that is), so I thought it'd be smart to create a new account whereas the Oceania server would support my location at the moment a lot better than having to queue all the way from Australia to North America...

I was wrong. The smurf I made was still stuck in North America. So then I thought the solution would be deleting League of Legends and reinstalling, because I got this cancer baby three years ago during my stay in the US. Maybe if I downloaded from Australia, it would offer a free transfer to the Oceanic server.

Wrong again. I bought my PC from America. American IP address, I thought.

So basically, if I install LoL on my grandma's laptop with an Australian IP address, will I be in the Oceanic server? And will I have to make a new account when I do? Or will it be fine if I log in with the smurf I made previously or even my main, all originating from the US?

halp pls

replies.body:
You're not getting a free transfer. (its 20 USD to transfer - for someone that moves from USA to Australia 20 is a small amount)

If the client is the problem, check top right corner before you hit  'launch' to change from NA to OCE server or whichever you want to be on.

Here's a picture showing what I mean. https://gyazo.com/1e6822b4e0db52ece88e854980566539
you probably didnt change regions in the launcher

Umm, your probably using a NA signup instead of the OCE.

https://signup.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/index?

You can buy a transfer of account to OCE or make a new account in OCE.

If you need help with the transfer, try [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751924)
